geo:FormInformation.geo:modifiedSection: EXTERNAL CESIUM frequency standard was installed

geo:SiteIdentification.geo:markerDescription: CENTER OF HOLE IN STEEL PLATE

geo:GnssReceiver.geo:notes: hardware replacement of receiver with SN 1128, same receiver, but different serial number (now 1436)
The receiver delay 1PPS in to 1PPS out was measured to be 145 ns.
The receiver delay 1PPS in to 1PPS out was measured to be 142.8 ns.
The receiver delay 1PPS in to 1PPS out was measured to be 142.8 ns.
The receiver delay 1PPS in to 1PPS out is supposed to be unchanged (142.8 ns).
The receiver delay 1PPS in to 1PPS out was remeasured and found to be unchanged (142.8 ns).

geo:GnssAntenna.geo:notes: Testing of ECCOSORB ANW-79 around antenna in order to obtain low reflectivity. Adaptation antenna height by + 2 mm due to a mounting plate which holds the ECCOSORB material under the antenna.

To shield the antenna from reflections on the dome below it, a 0.8x0.8 m^2 metal shield was installed with Eccosorb ANW-77 on top. The spacing between the ARP and the top of the Eccosorb ANW-77 is 17.8 cm. On 2015-12-09, the Eccosorb was replaced by a new more resistant version.

To shield the antenna from reflections on the dome below it, a 0.8x0.8 m^2 metal shield was installed with Eccosorb ANW-77 on top. The spacing between the ARP and the top of the Eccosorb ANW-77 is 17.8 cm. On 2015-12-09, the Eccosorb was replaced by a new more resistant version. Surge protection device, dly: L2 553, L1 525 ps.

geo:SurveyedLocalTie.geo:notes: L1 analysis covering period 2011-05-16 to 2011-07-22. An L3 analysis over the same period provides (12.161;47.329;-23.745). GPS data analysis was done using igs08.atx calibrations for BRUS and indiv.calib. for BRUX (from University of Bonn and TU Darmstadt).

L1 analysis covering period 2011-007-23 to 2012-02-12. An L3 analysis over the same period provides (12.166;47.334;-23.748). Differences between 5.2 and 5.3 are caused by an unexplained coordinate jump at BRUS at 2011-07-22. GPS data analysis was done using igs08.atx calibrations for BRUS and indiv.calib. for BRUX (from University of Bonn and TU Darmstadt).

geo:FrequencyStandard.geo:notes: At 12h UTC, 13h local time, on 2011-03-23 the receiver was stopped, recabeled with an external reference (namely UTC(ROB), derived from a HP5071A), and restarted.

The 5MHz output of the CH1-75A (maser3) passes a Minicircuits FD-2+ frequency doubler and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz output of the Symmetricom 5071A (ces1) is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.

The 5MHz output of the CH1-75A (maser3) passes a Minicircuits FD-2+ frequency doubler and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz of the Symmetricom 5071A (cesium2) is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.

The 5MHz output of the CH1-75A (maser3) passes an amplifier HP5087A and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.

The 5MHz output of the CESIUM 5071A (ces3) passes an amplifier HP5087A and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.

The 5MHz output of the CH1-75A (maser3) passes an amplifier HP5087A and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.

The 5MHz output of the CH1-75A (maser3) passes an amplifier HP5087A and then is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver. REFDLY = 157.5 ns.
The 10MHz output of the IMASER 3000 (maser4) is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz output of an HP5071A is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper for the steering on UTC. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz output of the IMASER 3000 (maser4) is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz output of an HP5071A is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper for the steering on UTC. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
The 10MHz output of the IMASER 3000 (maser4) is used as input to a SpectraTime femtoStepper. The output of this phase stepper (equal to UTC(ORB)) is used as an input to the receiver.
